originalText.text: I thought the service was good UNTIL -- they ruined an expensive ABC Carpet area rug. They admitted to the damage, and claimed it occurred during the normal cleaning/drying process.They reimbursed for half of the dry cleaning costs. The employee at the counter said he just does what he's told to do.

originalText.text:
Used multiple times for dry cleaning and alternations - sloppy work all around.

The hem job on one of my pant legs came undone, cuffs on a ($45) shirt alteration are uneven, late dry cleaning that left me in a scramble to find a shirt, dirt marks on dry cleaned shirt, plenty of loose threads, and two buttons fell off of a shirt shortly after them dry cleaning it.

Was right around the corner so I kept giving the benefit of the doubt - save yourself the trouble and find somewhere else

originalText.text:
Tower Cleaners shrunk my sweater after a basic "dry clean". I brought it back to the cleaners, and they told me that they would send it back to the factory to try to "fix" it. The sweater came back stretched out and further ruined, and all they could say is they followed standard dry cleaning.

At a minimum, I expected a refund for the dry cleaning fee and would have appreciated some reimbursement for my $350 sweater. It has been 1.5 weeks and management won't respond to me, and the store keeps giving me the run around.

I've never written a google review before but such atrocious service and response would not recommend using for any dry cleaning of valuable items.

originalText.text: I needed my pants tailored on short notice (two days turn around time) and they were able to do so. The seamstress was very kind and the prices wasn’t bad at all. I need my length shortened and my pant narrowed. Overall, I had a great experience for my first time and I will certainly go back to use this cleaners again.
